title: Google Announces its 2025 I/O Conference Dates
description: It's gonna be May. The post Google Announces its 2025 I/O Conference Dates appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
text: If you were wondering when this year’s Google I/O Developer Conference will be, then we’ve finally gotten official dates for the event – according to Google, I/O 2025 will be held on May 20-21, 2025 at the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, California. As usual, it will also be streamed live via Google’s official YouTube channel. With that in mind, Google wasn’t too specific as to what it was going to show off during the event, vaguely stating that it will present “newest products, technologies and innovations in AI” at this year’s conference. While it previously showed off the latest Pixel A-series phones at the event, it looks like this will not be the case this year as the Pixel 9a is expected to be shown off later in March. READ: New Online Leaks Reveal the Pixel 9a’s Different Color Options Google’s 2024 I/O Conference focused mostly on its AI products including Gemini (and several other models), with Android mostly taking a backseat during the presentation. With that said though, it should be interesting to see Google’s upcoming plans moving forward with Pixel, AI, and Android, to name a few.
html:
If you were wondering when this year’s Google I/O Developer Conference will be, then we’ve finally gotten official dates for the event – according to Google, I/O 2025 will be held on May 20-21, 2025 at the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, California. As usual, it will also be streamed live via Google’s official YouTube channel.

With that in mind, Google wasn’t too specific as to what it was going to show off during the event, vaguely stating that it will present “newest products, technologies and innovations in AI” at this year’s conference. While it previously showed off the latest Pixel A-series phones at the event, it looks like this will not be the case this year as the Pixel 9a is expected to be shown off later in March.

READ: New Online Leaks Reveal the Pixel 9a’s Different Color Options

Google’s 2024 I/O Conference focused mostly on its AI products including Gemini (and several other models), with Android mostly taking a backseat during the presentation. With that said though, it should be interesting to see Google’s upcoming plans moving forward with Pixel, AI, and Android, to name a few.
